rComments: literally argued with black students in class and then sent a follow-up email to the class arguing that he should be able to say the n-word.... literally needs to be fired

professor really disheartens students I had a bad experience with him after sending him an email about my difficulties with the class content. He took no time to try to help or even bother to clarify. I felt put down and less important than my peers just because I have a learning challenge. Would not recommend sending him emails.

Notice how all of Pare's decent reviews (like 3 in total) are from 2005. Yeah he's fallen a long long way from glory since then. Not a kind human would never take a course with him if there was another option. If you don't have to take POL 3102 immediately wait on the next semester rather than taking him.
Pare needs to take a lesson on how to give lessons ...

Guys seriously DO NOT take this man's class. The university should stop giving him contracts. I'm pretty sure he read these texts once in his life and makes up stuff in between. Doesn't answer emails and seriously has a rude attitude. Kind of sad he has to teach mandatory classes.

His lectures are effectively useless as he spends most of the time talking about irrelevant examples rather than actually explaining the texts - you're better off just doing the readings and hoping for the best.

Reading heavy, the biggest downfall for everyone involved is his lack of ability to explain his assignments and what he wants as well as being unsupportive. Do not trust his syllabus he will ask for one thing and grade according to something else. There can be an improvement but most will take an L on the first assignment. Weird course format too

Just avoid this prof at all costs! If you want to maintain your GPA! I am by no means a lazy student, I work hard for my grades. It doesn't matter how hard you work this prof is just awful. I think he gets a thrill from sabotaging students.
this guy would flex that he mosty gave bad grades which to me is honestly embarrassing. like just say you're a bad prof and go, enough w this pick-me attitude.
Avoid him if you plan to apply graduate school because his class really hurts your gpa
Very tough grader. Paper worth 80%. Have to take the final exam if you like to raise your grade.
I have never been more afraid of a prof than I am of him. He literally scares me.

This man is the definition of all over the place and unfair. We were supposed to have an essay outline, essay and final as assignments but due to COVID he cancelled the final. HOWEVER, instead of distributing the rest of the 40% to the other 2 assignment like he was supposed to, our paper was worth 80% of our grade which was whack. He's just meh.

stay away!!!! this guy's ego is so huge & you barely have the chance to get past his compulsive devil's advocate behaviour to actually learn anything. Also he is the hardest grader ever (a C is an accomplishment in his class) and he will jump at any opportunity to randomly accuse you of cheating.
Just don't take the class, that's it. It's not worth your pain. He should be under review by the university

The class overall wasn't terrible, neither was his teaching, but the way he grades papers is ridiculous. He genuinely thinks that a C is a good grade, that you have to be absolutely incredible and a prodigy to get an A or B. This class made my GPA go down, was not worth it. Just don't bother with this class, take it with another prof.
Just dont do it :)
teacherRatingTags: ['Lots of homework', 'Get ready to read', 'Tough grader']

rComments: I think i will have flashbacks to how awful this class was for the rest of my life.....I didn't think it was possible to be this bad. Take this is you want to work you're behind off only to get C's (as a straight A student)

The assignments themselves in theory shouldn't be hard, but with no instructions and than crazy hard grading they're awful. Please explain how you can get an A on one paper then fail the next when they're the same format? Asking because he wouldn't! Is tangents are never ending, but he will call it out on your paper. Simply just don't do it!!!

Taking this class was the worst decision I've ever made. His lectures are ridiculous, for a 3 hour class he would spend the 2 hours talking about irrelevant examples. Gives no instructions for assignments and marks solely based on his opinion, he will then yell when you question his marking, he views a C as a good grade.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Tough grader', 'Graded by few things']

rComments: Many whiney students who can't follow his lectures because they didn't do the readings. Do the readings, go to class, take care in writing your assignments. His grading is generous and fair. I could nitpick yes, but good prof overall for a part-time prof.

Honestly not that great of a teacher. He is definitely passionate in what he teaches but has trouble communicating it properly. Jumps from one idea to another without concluding anything. Too much information and not enough clear explanations... A lot of readings and you must attend class. Would not take him again thats for sure.
Great professor.

The. Worst. Ever. First of all, this was a research class and he did not teach us anything about research. Second, his grading is as follows: if you do everything 100% correct, you get a 80%. You have to WOW him to get any higher, but make sure you say word for word what he says in class, but even thats always wrong. theres no winning. avoid.

Monsieur Paré laisse beaucoup de place à la participation. Comme n'importe quel cours, il faut avoir fait les lectures pour réussir à participer. La structure du cours est claire et ses attentes envers les étudiants aussi. Le cours n'est pas spécialement difficile, un minimum d'implication permet d'avoir de bons résultats.

The professor was alright, but then he started to go on these rants and somehow related family issues and court politics to class topics. I don't approach him after class now, I just ask classmates. Lectures are alright, but the textbook is crap. Anyway, mediocre at best, but potential to be really good, minus the personal stuff. :p
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Graded by few things', 'Lecture heavy']

rComments: The professor is okay - he is super nice and has the potential to be interesting. But since the textbook he uses is extremely boring and abstract, the class tends to be a bore. BUT, it is very easy to get a good grade: he gives you the questions ahead of time for the midterm and the exam but there is also a 5 person group project which sucked

Great professor for first year students. Expectations are clear, material is well-presented and assignments are relevant. The textbook, however, was a very abstract interpretation of an "intro à la science politique." The textbook was quite difficult to work with but Paré did a great job regardless.
Very boring.. talks too much and never says anything very clear. Weird grading (15 percent of my grade was peer evaluation)
Very interesting professor.  Explains readings very well, and open to class discussion.  Often funny, always fair, definitely worth taking!

Great professor! He is an amazing lecturer and makes every class interesting.  Not the kind of prof to read from slides or repeat material from textbooks.  He is very engaging! If you want to learn, this class is worth it. If you want an easy grade though stay away.  This guy's not an easy grader, but if you're attentive in class you should be ok!
Great lecturer but not easy to have a good grade in his class

Extremely interesting lecturer. Great dynamic in class. Encourages participation without making it mandatory. He is willing to meet out of class and is quite helpful. He gives few guidelines on assignments but that is because he wants to give you the freedom to explore. I strongly suggest this professor, at least for this class. He knows his stuff!

Engaging lecturer and clearly interested in the material, but an extremely rude person. He demands respect from the students without earning it and will not repeat himself if you miss something he has said - and he has a bit of an accent. Questions for tests given in advance but no instructions are provided.

Worst prof ever he is very good at lecturing but he is the worst since he wont help you in your essays.He clearly is very rude.I would never suggest for anyone to take him as a prof unless u wanna just get a grade without learning anything sufficient.

This prof is great. He made every class interesting. Although he never used lectures slides, his conveyed the information clearly and engaged the class in his discussions. I would recommend this class to anyone and everyone so long as he's the teacher.

Phenomenal professor! Very engaging and effective with a great sense of humour to boot. Always open to questions in class... it's obvious he wants to make sure we 'get it', he's not just there to put in his time and leave. I definitely hope I end up in one of his courses again!!

Allright guy/class if your into political philosophy. The class was research methods yet it turned into political philosophy. All the coursepack readings are online. My suggestion is that you just borrow your buddies coursepack, search all of the readings online and book mark them. Save yourself 50 bucks.

Great professor!The readings were quite difficult near the end of the course but he gives you the Qs in advance for the exams.You need to go to class in order to understand the readings and although he clarifies things well,sometimes there wasn't enough time to clarify everything.Other/w it was a good and fair class!

Great teacher.  If the level of students was higher, his class would have been more demanding.  He went easy on us, honestly.  There was a lot of reading, but hey, if you're in politics EXPECT IT! That's how you learn.  He explains things well, and won't mind repeating a thousand times just for you to understand.  He makes times outside class also.

I really did not like the class... but he was an ok prof. As long as you attend class regularly you will do well. The mid-term and exam question were given in advance. However, the paper for the class was based on newspaper articles and he didn't really explain it well.Overall, I would avoid taking another class with him!

He's good, but you really have to force yourself to understand him. I feel that because there is so much to tell, he dosen't know where to begin. But overall, he a good prof, he gives you the midterm and final exam questions and he's very helpful during office hours. Biggest advice, don't miss a class cause otherwise, it can indeed get confusing:)

not a great lecturer but he so much as hands you an A in the class. he frequently tells you the questions for the midterms and exams..so go the classes..and he also marks them very easily. when the class did poorly on the midterm he actually gave us the same test for the final exam..

Terrible lecturer. Just tends to write random words on the blackboard and then circles them...repeatedly. Made fun of himself and Québec quite a bit, which was funny. Pretty easy marker. But even then, I'd avoid having him as a prof again. Felt like I learned nothing.
Easily my favorite professor. Managed to make the most boring subject matter interesting, and made class entertaining as well. Fair marker, and very considerate with appeals.

Great lecturer, as long as you pay attention. He's entertaining and so cute! The text for this class is good but difficult, but the accompanying lectures are very helpful in clarifying issues. Provided you are interested in the subject matter, this prof is very good. Assignments and exams are not bad as long as you know the material.
A hard class and a hard text book to understand. The midterm is difficult and i thought he marked the papers fairly. you must attend class to do well in his class.

Alright..unless you follow politics on a regular basis..this class is quite a challenge, but you'll learn alot..he's a tough marker..but oh my is he ever FINE..let me tell you the material is dry..but you'll sit through the class just to stare @ him ;)

The text sucks, hard to read and understand, but this teacher rocks. hes helpful and tries to teach the class to the best of his ability. This is a difficult class though. Need to pay attention and try to take a lot of notes to understand the text.

Terrible prof. I was going to do a double major in poli sci until I took this unfortunate class. He is a very nice guy, good sense of humour... but his lectures are guaranteed to make even the worst insomniac fall into a coma.

Not a hard prof, but his lectures are waaay too slow and boring. Unbearable to attend, and yet he doesn't repeat information that was mentioned in class probably cause nobody would attend if he put info on the web like the better profs do. Great if you want to be treated like infant. Hot in jeans!

you really need to pay attention to his lectures. this may come off as a little overwhelming to first years who take the course. he paced the course so that the readings were light/simple.  He also outlines what is going to be on the exam, so there's no sense in getting a poor mark. cute prof

he's a nice guy..kinda cute;) but the class is a little fast paced. you have to pay attention for key points, he'll help u as much as possible. t really helps if you've taken any classes (university or not) in economics.

This dude is obviously new to teaching, but it seems he has a genuine understanding of subject matter. His accent is a bit crazy (really french) but he marks pretty easy for mid-terms and such. No structure for lectures, so make sure to pay attention for key points! Looks wicked in a pair of jeans!

he is very helpful, and he tells you EXACTLY what will be on the mid-term and final. that may seem easy, but because of this, he expects much more from his students. overall, he is a good and knowledgeable prof with a great sense of humour.
